member.name: T:BotSuite.Window
member.summary: Class with function for windows handling

member.name: M:BotSuite.Window.SetFrontWindow(System.String)
member.summary: set a window into the front

member.name: M:BotSuite.Window.ShowWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: show a window

member.name: M:BotSuite.Window.GetAllMainWindows
member.summary: collect MainWindows

example.code: List<IntPtr> hWnds = new List<IntPtr>(); hWnds = Window.GetAllMainWindows();

member.returns: Returns an array of window handles.

member.name: M:BotSuite.Window.FindWindowByProcessName(System.String)
member.summary: try to find a window by using the name of the corresponding process

member.name: M:BotSuite.Window.FindWindowByWindowTitle(System.String)
member.summary: get a handle of a window by name

member.name: M:BotSuite.Window.FindWindowByProcessId(System.Int32)
member.summary: get a handle of a window by the id of the process
member.param: The process Id of the process in question.

member.name: T:BotSuite.Keyboard
member.summary: A class that manages a global low level keyboard hook

member.name: F:BotSuite.Keyboard.HookedKeys
member.summary: The collections of keys to watch for

member.name: F:BotSuite.Keyboard.hhook
member.summary: Handle to the hook, need this to unhook and call the next hook

member.name: M:BotSuite.Keyboard.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and installs the keyboard hook.
member.remarks: use the whole class by the code from the example!

member.name: M:BotSuite.Keyboard.Finalize
member.summary: unmanaged resources were released and other cleanup operations were performed before the is reclaimed by garbage collection and uninstalls the keyboard hook.

member.name: M:BotSuite.Keyboard.hook
member.remarks: this is a private method. You cannot us it! See the construtor #ctor for an example.

member.name: M:BotSuite.Keyboard.unhook
member.summary: Uninstalls the global hook
member.remarks: this is a private method. You cannot us it! See the construtor #ctor for an example.

member.name: M:BotSuite.Keyboard.hookProc(System.Int32,System.Int32,BotSuite.NativeMethods.keyboardHookStruct@)
member.summary: callback for the keyboard hook
member.remarks: this is a private method. You cannot us it! See the constructor #ctor for an example.

member.name: M:BotSuite.Keyboard.Type(System.String)
member.summary: types a key or o sequence of keys

example.code: Keyboard.Type("{ENTER}"); // click the enter button Keyboard.Type("ENTER"); // types "E","N","T","E","R"

member.name: M:BotSuite.Keyboard.HoldKey(System.Byte,System.Int32)
member.summary: Hold down a key for a specific time

example.code: Keyboard.HoldKey((byte)Keys.A, 250); // Holds down the "A" key for 250ms Keyboard.HoldKey((byte)Keys.Left, 1000); // Holds down "Left" key for 1 second

member.name: M:BotSuite.Keyboard.IsKeyDown(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: test if a key is pressed

example.code: // test if F1 is currently pressed bool pressed = Keyboard.IsKeyDown(Keys.F1);

member.name: E:BotSuite.Keyboard.KeyDown
member.summary: Occurs when one of the hooked keys is pressed

member.name: E:BotSuite.Keyboard.KeyUp
member.summary: Occurs when one of the hooked keys is released

member.name: T:BotSuite.Net.HttpClient
member.summary: HttpClient class for making bots for Browsergames

member.name: M:BotSuite.Net.HttpClient.#ctor(System.String,BotSuite.Net.HttpProxy,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: constructor for the HttpClient class
member.param: defines if proxy should be used or not for requests
the Referer the first request will be sent from, i.e. www.google.com

member.name: M:BotSuite.Net.HttpClient.POST(System.String,BotSuite.Net.HttpPostDataCollection,System.String)
member.summary: sends a HTTP POST request to a given URL with given POST data and a optional referer
member.param: the URL to send the post request to
the referer to send the request from

member.name: M:BotSuite.Net.HttpClient.GET(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: sends a HTTP GET request to a given URL with a optional referer

example.code: var hc = new HttpClient("some-user-agent", "www.google.de"); var html = hc.GET("http://www.codebot.de");

member.param: the URL to send the request to
the referer to send the request from

member.name: M:BotSuite.Net.HttpClient.SourcecodeToImage(System.String)
member.summary: tries to convert a sourcecode-string (i.e. from a POST or GET request) into an image (works only if the response was an image)
member.param: the sourcecode-string that comes from a POTS or GET request
member.returns: null, if unable to convert to image, else an System.Drawing.Image object

member.name: P:BotSuite.Net.HttpClient.AutoReferer
member.summary: true, if the HttpClient should adjust the Referer at every change of the URL

member.name: P:BotSuite.Net.HttpClient.Referer
member.summary: the current Referer

member.name: P:BotSuite.Net.HttpClient.UseProxy
member.summary: true, if the HttpClient should use the HttpClient.Proxy for requests

member.name: P:BotSuite.Net.HttpClient.Proxy
member.summary: proxy object with settings for proxy usage for requests (when HttpClient.UseProxy is set to true)

member.name: P:BotSuite.Net.HttpClient.UseUnsafeHeaderParsing
member.summary: useUnsafeHeaderParsing

member.summary: defines the callback type for the hook

member.name: M:BotSuite.NativeMethods.SetWindowsHookEx(System.Int32,BotSuite.NativeMethods.keyboardHookProc,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the windows hook, do the desired event, one of hInstance or threadId must be non-null
member.param: The id of the event you want to hook
The handle you want to attach the event to, can be null
The thread you want to attach the event to, can be null
member.returns: a handle to the desired hook

member.name: M:BotSuite.NativeMethods.UnhookWindowsHookEx(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Unhooks the windows hook.
member.param: The hook handle that was returned from SetWindowsHookEx

member.summary: Calls the next hook.
